captions.text:
OK, this hair-do is sort
of like a French braid.

We're going to start on the
left side of her head, which

is the side with the
least amount of hair.

I've parted her
hair on the left.

You can part it on the right
and reverse the process,
if you need to.

And I've wet her hair
down, just slightly wet.

I just think it holds the
hair in tighter and better

throughout the day, if it
starts out a little bit damp.

So if you just take a comb
and kind of straighten out

any bumps or lumps,
this kind of ensures

that things will go
in straighter too.

So you start by just getting
a little section of hair.

There's no rhyme or reason to
how much or anything tricky.

And divide it into
three sections,

as though you're going
to start a French braid.

Cross those two,
and then cross that.

So you're just starting
a French braid.

The only tricky thing
about this braid

is, I only pick up
from the bottom, which

makes the braid stick out just
a little more than normal,
and I like that.

Since I have a bottom
piece I'm working with,

I'm going to pick up some
hair and twist it in.

C Now, normally
in a French braid,

you'd come up here near the
top and pick up hair and add it
into this top piece.
I'm not going to do that.

So I just bring that
back into the braid.

And again, now
I'm at the bottom,

so I'm going to pick
up hair and add it in.

Again, I'm not going to
pick up anything on the top,

just switch those two pieces
and continue doing that,

as you work your
way around the head.

On this braid, I kind
of like to follow
the back curve of their head.

So I try to stay not up too
high, like it's a crown.

I try to follow the bottom
baseline of their head.
So just keep braiding.

And you'll see as we
go along that what

happens is, because the top
part isn't being secured down

by hair, it ends up popping
out just a little bit

and kind of shows up more than
a normal brain, which I like.

But if you don't like
it, add the hair in.

Turn your head
this way a little.

And you can see
why right here I've

almost got little
bumps going on.

That's just because I didn't
comb the hair down tight enough
to begin with.

So you want to kind of watch
for that as you're going along.
Turn.

And I just go all the
way around her head,

until I start
running out of hair.

Then I pull that last
section, kind of the big one.
Pull it.

When you get to about the
ear, kind of pull down.
And I take an elastic.
Do I have a big one?
And secure it behind your ear.
It's tight, sorry.

There we go-- into just a side
ponytail right by her ear.

And then you can
fluff this anyway you

want or add a ribbon
right here or a flower.

And then I just secure
with some hairspray.

And you have the
wrap-around French braid.
So here's a flower.

title: Wrap-Around Twist Side Ponytail | Cute Girls Hairstyles
